casebody.data:
STATE of Louisiana
v.
Dolan MCGINNIS No. 2019-KK-77 Supreme Court of Louisiana. January 18, 2019 ON SUPERVISORY WRITS TO THE CRIMINAL DISTRICT COURT, PARISH OF ORLEANS Denied. HUGHES, J., would grant and assigns reasons. Hughes, J., would grant the writ.

La. C. Crim. Proc. article 312(F) provides that after sentence and until final judgment, bail shall be allowed if a sentence of 5 years or less is actually imposed.
